---
title: "default.yaml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file defines configuration for feature flags in a testing environment. It specifies two different types of flags: a variant flag and a boolean flag, each with its own set of properties.

## Symbols

### version
#### Description
Specifies the version of the configuration format being used.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| version | string | The version number of the configuration format |

### flags
#### Description
An array of feature flag configurations, each defining a specific flag with its properties.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| flags | array | A list of feature flag configurations |

For each flag in the array:

### flag
#### Description
Defines a single feature flag with its properties.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | A unique identifier for the flag |
| name | string | A human-readable name for the flag |
| type | string | The type of the flag (e.g., VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE, BOOLEAN_FLAG_TYPE) |
| description | string | A brief description of the flag's purpose |
| enabled | boolean | Whether the flag is currently enabled or disabled |

## Configuration
This file defines the following configuration options:

| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| version | string | "1.2" | The version of the configuration format |
| flags | array | N/A | An array of feature flag configurations |

### Feature Flags
The file defines two feature flags:

1. Variant Flag:
   - Key: flag_variant
   - Name: Alternate Flag Type Variant
   - Type: VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE
   - Description: Variant Flag Description
   - Enabled: false

2. Boolean Flag:
   - Key: flag_boolean
   - Name: Alternate Flag Type Boolean
   - Type: BOOLEAN_FLAG_TYPE
   - Description: Boolean Flag Description
   - Enabled: true

This configuration allows for testing different flag types and states in an integration testing environment.
